code: @Manual{,   title = {DiagnoDating: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis},   author = {Xavier Didelot},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/xavierdidelot/DiagnoDating}, }

what: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis
title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis
text: aim package diagnose results phylogeny dating analysis. Many tools exist produce dated phylogenies, several factors can invalidate results. includes confounding effect population structure can dating. also includes incorrect assumptions made running dating analysis, example using inappropriate clock model, accounting recombination, etc.

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis
text: can install DiagnoDating github : package can loaded using:
code: devtools::install_github("xavierdidelot/DiagnoDating") library(DiagnoDating,quietly=T)

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis
text: basic example usage. First generate dated tree 10 samples 2000 2020:  Next generate phylogenetic tree using Poisson(10) mutation model, perform root--tip analysis:  can run dating analysis phylogeny follows:  can perform posterior predictive check:  can see likelihood branch:  can compute residuals:  can compute posterior distribution residual p-values:
code: dates=runif(10,2000,2020) dt=simcoaltree(dates) plot(dt) axisPhylo(backward=F) phy=simobsphy(dt,mu=10,model='poisson') r=roottotip(phy,dates) r=runDating(phy,dates) plot(r) p=ppcheck(r,showPlot = T,showProgress = F) plotLikBranches(r) plotResid(r) p=postdistpvals(r,showPlot = T) #> The posterior distribution of p-values has median 0.58 and 4.40% of values below 5%

title: DiagnoDating: diagnostics for dated phylogenetic analysis
text: detailed examples use DiagnoDating, see vignettes . See also help included package using R command help(package='DiagnoDating'). problem question please create issue get touch emailing xavier.didelot@gmail.com
